channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large road sign, 28th July
item.description:
After road works a large sign has been left in road near 2 York Avenue . Please can we arrange for it to be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, York Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant illegal parking of delivery trucks and vans, 28th July
item.description:
Vehicules parking at the crossing of Laburnum Ln and Whiston Rd. This narrows down the visibility for local residents of Laburnum Lane, vehicules cruise at 40mph+ on Whiston Road. This is a fatality waiting to happen More law enforcement or Zebra crossing

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whiston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Gate slow closer missing, 28th July
item.description:
This gate does not close quietly. The closer is missing. This gate bangs at least 100 times a day starting early in the morning with dog walkers and continuing late into the night. The weekends are worse. The noise can be heard inside the house and stood young children from sleeping. This is an environmental noise pollution and is affecting all the neighbours. It is not acceptable

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Long Lane, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White lidded bin dumped in orchard road, 28th July
item.description:
There is a white lidded bin that has been there for around 5 months, its by the side of number 9 orchard road, this bin is empty as it keeps blowing over in the wind.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchard Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadwroks but no WORK!, 28th July
item.description:
There have been 24/7 2 way traffic light restrictions operating (with consequent traffic congestion) near the junction of Crofton Lane with Derwent Drive for weeks yet no sight of any work being done at all. The problem appears to be a slightly subsided previous repair (poor backfilling as usual I'd suspect) so why is this taking so long to resolve? No doubt work will commence just after the schools reopen just to prolong and maximise the disruption! If the problem is far more serious than this, why not just sign the works accordingly so us mere council tax payers can understand the delay?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crofton Lane, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Bathtub, 28th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169, Sumner Road, Peckham, London
